2.caption: Global melting: Though it may seem counterintuitive, melting glaciers in one area may cause local sea levels to drop—while causing a rise in sea levels farther away.

3.caption: RISE AND FALL: A melting ice sheet has two effects on sea level. Diminished gravitational attraction lowers the sea near an ice sheet. At the same time, water flowing into the ocean raises it. So if the Greenland ice sheet collapsed into the sea, the melt water would dramatically raise global sea levels. But nearby countries would see sea levels dip.
